SEARCH
Package core

Class CheckersLogic

java.lang.Object
core.CheckersLogic
public class CheckersLogic extends Object
This class contains the core logic behind simple checkers.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    CheckersLogic.Player
    Enum representing the possible states of a board cell: it can be occupied by player X's piece, player O's piece, or be empty.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CheckersLogic()
    Initializes a new game of checkers, setting up the board and the starting player.

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckersLogic

      public CheckersLogic()
      Initializes a new game of checkers, setting up the board and the starting player.

  • Method Details

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Attempts to move a piece from one position to another. This method checks if the move is legal and updates the board accordingly.
      Parameters:
      startX - the starting X coordinate of the piece to move
      startY - the starting Y coordinate of the piece to move
      endX - the ending X coordinate of the piece to move
      endY - the ending Y coordinate of the piece to move
      Returns:
      true if the piece was moved successfully, false otherwise

    • isValidPosition

      public boolean isValidPosition(int row, int col)
      Checks if the given position is within the bounds of the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row number to check
      col - the column number to check
      Returns:
      true if the position is within the bounds of the board, false otherwise.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Checks if a move is valid based on the game's rules. It checks the bounds, ensures the destination is empty, and the move is diagonal.
      Parameters:
      startX - the starting X coordinate of the piece
      startY - the starting Y coordinate of the piece
      endX - the ending X coordinate of the piece
      endY - the ending Y coordinate of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkGameEnd

      public void checkGameEnd()
      Checks if the game has reached an end condition. Specifically, it checks if either player has no remaining pieces or no possible moves. It updates the 'gameEnded' field accordingly.

    • getBoard

      public CheckersLogic.Player[][] getBoard()
      Retrieves the current state of the game board. Each cell on the board is represented by a Player enum, indicating whether it's occupied by player X's piece, player O's piece, or empty.
      Returns:
      A 2D array representing the current state of the game board.

    • isGameEnded

      public boolean isGameEnded()
      Checks if the game has ended.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, false otherwise.

    • isValidJump

      public boolean isValidJump(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Checks if a jump is valid. A jump is considered valid if it's over an opponent's piece and lands in an empty space.
      Parameters:
      startX - the starting X coordinate of the piece
      startY - the starting Y coordinate of the piece
      endX - the ending X coordinate of the piece
      endY - the ending Y coordinate of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the jump is valid, false otherwise.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public CheckersLogic.Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Retrieves the current player.
      Returns:
      the current player.
